intro: Warneckea ngutiensis, commonly known as the Nguti warneckea, is a flowering plant species native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
